primary.title: Low-tech gadgets have biggest impact for older people, research finds
primary.summary: New research undertaken by housing and ageing experts at the University of Stirling has found that introducing low tech gadgets to retirement living schemes has a major impact on health and well-being.

primary.title: Voucher scheme highly effective at helping stop smoking in pregnancy, study finds
primary.summary: A high street voucher scheme is highly effective in helping women stop smoking during pregnancy, according to new research involving the University of Stirling.

primary.title: Research shows music and movement hits right note with care home residents
primary.summary: A pilot study by the University of Stirling has found that music and movement can have a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of care home residents – and could lead to similar activities being rolled out on a wider scale.
primary.imagealt: danceSing initiative at Balhousie Care Home

secondary.title: New research explains dramatic reduction of ivory trade in Japan
secondary.summary: With implications for global wildlife trade, research from the University of Stirling and National Institute for Environmental Studies (NIES), Japan has shown how Japan, once the largest consumer country of ivory, stopped being a destination for the product.
secondary.imagealt: Pile of animal tusks for sale in the local shop in market in the Old town of Fenghuang, Hunan Province, China

secondary.title: Pandemic has worsened global childhood physical inactivity crisis – and Scotland is no exception
secondary.summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated shortfalls in children’s physical activity around the world, including in Scotland, according to a new study involving the University of Stirling.

secondary.title: PR student’s success marks hat-trick for Stirling at major European award
secondary.summary: A public relations graduate has picked up a major academic award – marking the third time a Stirling student has been recognised at the annual EUPRERA Master Thesis Awards.
secondary.imagealt: Anne Cumming photographed with her award certificate.
